org.orgName: District Court of the United States for the District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF BEN WA, FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS FOR TUNG KEE
Comes now Ben Wa and petitions the above entitled court and shows as follows, to wit:

That heretofore and on or about the thirteenth day of April, 1912, Tung Kee arrived at a port of the United States, on board the steam ship "Talthybius", and applied to the inspector of the United States in charge for entry, and the said Tung Kee alleged and proved before the said inspector that he was a citizen of the United States, having been born in the City of Portland in the State of Oregon, of Chinese parentage.

That the local inspector in charge of the hearing denied the application of the said Tung Kee, and an appeal was prosecuted to the secretary of Commerce and Labor, who hertofore affirmed the decision of the local office, and an order has been made by the secretary of Commerce and Labor to deport the said Tung Kee to China, and said order of deportation is about to be carried out by Ellis De Bruler, Commissioner of Immigration stationed in the City of Seattle, County of King and State of Washington, although the said Tung Kee is a citizen of the United States and entitled to remain in the United States, and said order will be enforced unless the same is stayed by order of this court.

That the record of the hearing before the inspector of the United States at the time of the application of the said Tung Kee for admission, shows upon its face a clear record and the clear right of the said Tung Kee to be admitted and to remain in the United States.

That the only witnesses who testified therein testified clearly and unequivocally that the said Tung Kee was bron in the said City of Portland, Oregon, and gave facts and data in reference thereto which would convince the mind of any person of the absolute right the said Tung Kee had to remain in the United States.

That the evidence for the said Tung Kee at such hearing was of such an undisputable character that the rejection of his said application amounts to and is a denial of a fair hearing and consideration of his case, to which he is entitled under the constiution of the United States, and by reason of said decision of the inspector, together with the affirmance thereof by the secretary of Commerce and Labor, on account of said clear and convincing proof, is a denial of justice to the said Tung Kee, and the said Tung Kee has been deprived of his liberty without due process of law in contravention of the constitution of the United States.

That your petitioner hereby refers to the testimony and proof introduced at the hearing before the inspector, by reason of which hearing an order of deportation was entered against the said Tung Kee, and makes said proof and testimony a part of the petition herein as fully as if copied at length in this petition.

WHEREFORE your petitioner prays that a writ of habeas corpus be issued, directed to Ellis De Bruler, Commissioner of Immigration, Seattle, Wash., directing him to produce the body of the said Tung Kee before this court, and upon hearing, that he be released and given permission to remain in the United States, and that an order be issued herein, directed to the said Ellis De Bruler, directing him cause why such a writ of habeas corpus should not be granted, and that a further order be granted herein, directed to the said Ellis De Bruler, to withhold the order of deportation against the said Tung Kee until the final adjudication herein.
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON }Ss.

BEN WA, being first duly sworn, on the oath desposes and says: That he is the petitioner in the above matter, that he has read the foregoing, knows the contents thereof, and the statements made are true, as he verily believes.
Subscribed and sworn to before me as July 9, 1912
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle
